page.title: 19LIFE ON A DAIRY FARM
page.content: On Forda Farm the cows are milked twice daily at 7 am and 6.30 pm. Milking takes two hours. The farmer's wife brings in the cows while the farmer prepares the parlour. Five cows at a time enter each side of the herringbone parlour.The farmer stands below in a pit to wash the udders and attach the clusters. These are attached to a jar connected by pipes to a bulk tank. After milking, the cows' teats are covered in an antiseptic solution and they are let out. At 9.30 the milk tanker collects the milk. In addition to constant maintenance of land, machinery, fences and buildings, there are many seasonal jobs. In April and June the fields are fertilized and in May and July silage is cut. The cattle are kept in from November to April and fed on silage. The farmer's wife cares for the calves
